name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Brussels - Le Palace

reviews.text: Had a review meeting dealing with an EU project I am involved in. CP is just in front of the building were the meeting took place.
reviews.title: A perfect place for a visit to Brussels
weekend break " great location for shopping and sightseeing"
reviews.text: Arrived VERY early, around 07:00 in the morning and received a room with a smile. this was great as I had an overnight flight and was just exhausted. The room was great. clean, silent and comfortable.
Breakfast was very rich and tasty.
reviews.title: Wonderful city break in Brussels

reviews.text: The concierge was helpful in finding restaurants and places to visit.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: All in all - a great place. Will be back.
reviews.title: A favorite business hotel of mine in Brussels

reviews.text: I am often in Brussels for work and I usually stay-out of habit perhaps-near the Gare du Nord, and therefore, near the direct trains to the airport. I have tried a lot of hotels in the vicinity and mostly used to stay at the Hilton next door, however after trying the Crowne Plaza I think I will return here. I found the standard room to be very comfortable and more than adequet for my needs. The bathroom was large and very clean. As some pointed out there isn't much closet space however if you're staying for a couple of days it's adequet. As for the food I've only had breakfast in the hotel, it had plenty of healthy choices as well as english breakfast, so you're pretty set up for the day.
reviews.title: Probably one of the best hotels in the Gare du Nord area of Brussels

reviews.text: Overall a very good hotel, perhaps one of the best in the area. Most importantly it felt clean, comfy and also safe, which for me-a solo female traveller on business-is all that I ask for in a hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - but very quiet !!

reviews.text: we arrived on a Friday night and there was no shopping to be done until just before we left on Monday!!!! to be fair it wasn't the reason for the trip - this area is geared up for business clearly!!! The hotel is lush!! our room was really nice and it was a smoking room!! The bar is expensive but hey aren't they all
reviews.title: Presedential Suite

reviews.text: Being upgraded is always nice - especially to the Presential Suite! Unfortuneately it was only for one night! I have stayed in this hotel many times, and every time the breakfast has been included. It was therefore strange, staying in a suite like this one, finding out that breakfast was not included!
reviews.title: Quite old and noisy

reviews.text: This hotel is close to downtown Brussels in the area of the botanical garden.
reviews.title: A little pricey for vacation travel, but worth it

reviews.text: Spent three nights here recently.Rejected first room given(6th floor) because of constant noise from exhaust outlet near room.Helpful staff on front desk quickly found us another quieter room.Good housekeeping,friendly staff,great location.We travelled by Eurostar and it was easy to get to hotel from Brussels Nord.Breakfasts busy but efficient.Would use again.
reviews.title: Excellent location,helpful staff,very clean rooms

reviews.text: I have been going to this hotel for 3 years. It is centrally located: very easily reachable from airport (nearby train to North Station in 15 mins, taxi in 25 mins only but expensive 40 €) and the wonderful Grand Place and shopping area is at a nice walk distance. The metro stops in front if the back door of the hotel (Place Rogiers) but in evening time you need a room card key to open it.
reviews.title: Good central hotel, super comfy beds, small rooms

reviews.text: Rooms are very small, especially the space for your luggage is limited and also the closet is rather small, enough for cloths for a couple of days though. Daily filled coffee, tea and excellent hot chocolate included in the price. The beds are super comfy, especially the huge king size beds, the twin beds are a bit too narrow (but equally comfy). The aircon/heating is not central, you can switch it on/off, but it works only when the key card is inserted in the wall niche. The window can be opened a little bit only, it is secured by a chain. The majority of rooms are quiet, as they all look on an internal blind yard part which actually lacks much light but is very quiet at least. Neighbouring rooms' windows are very close but curtains give a good solution.
reviews.title: There is better and it's not even cheap

reviews.text: Free wifi in rooms is available and a comfortable desk+armchair guarantees a good work.
reviews.title: Magic beds

reviews.text: Paying for an upgraded room is not really worth: the upper class rooms are same in everything but a little bit bigger (yet closets are too small even there) and have street view: this is nice in theory but due to 24/7 city traffic they are much more noisy than the standars rooms. Ah, and there is a special part of the hotel on the 1st floor where the rooms are a bit diffrent: comfy beds and furniture are the same as in normal rooms but these ones have not been refurbished and can be approached by a staircase apart from the main one - a bit strange.
reviews.title: Very classy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at the Crown Plaza Hotel in Brussels - Le Palace. Very nice hotel, ultra chic, very clean, provides you with a comfortable bed, a kettle, iron and ironing board in the room. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. They offer a brunch at 27.00Euro, which we found quite expensive and we opted not to take it.
reviews.title: Holiday in Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in the heart of this busy city and is in walking distance to the shops and the main square.
reviews.title: a gorgeous old hotel with staff that make it all that much better

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Ok... first of all I need to address some of the comments made on here about the rooms being dated... The architecture is a mix of art deco and art nouveau which is in keeping with the character of the actual building. That is not to say that the fittings and fixtures are original, they aren't but the hotel has been recently (in the last few years from my enquiries) renovated in the art deco/art nouveau style and it has been done very nicely in my opinion... if this style isn't to your liking that's ok... but it certainly doesn't detract from the functionality of the room at all. The room we had had no view to speak of as the window faced a wall but the window itself was large and let in adequate natural light during the day. The room was quite large with a desk and a couch, arm chair and stand alone wardrobes and as one would expect from a Crowne Plaza it was kept spotlessly clean. The breakfast was good and whilst i agree with some reviewers that the price was a bit excessive it was included in our deal rate which is why we enjoyed it. At the price mentioned in previous reviews we wouldn't have availed ourselves of it, rather grabbed breakfast at one of the numerous eateries in close proximity. Overall we were very happy with the hotel itself but what stood out for me was the staff. there were all very professional but i sought out the duty manager on our second day there to let him know of one particular staff member who I felt out of his way to be helpful to the extent of looking up and printing off train timetables for some day trips we wanted to take whilst we were staying at the hotel and indeed AFTER we had left the hotel... for me that is going above and beyond... for the life of me I can't think of that young mans name at the moment but i did write a report about him and gave it to the Guest Experience Manager, a young man by the name of Alexandre Francois, who also is a credit to the hotel. On our last day as we were checking out he handed me an envelope which contained a handwritten note thanking me for taking the time to give positive feedback. I travel a lot and there will always be minor problems with check ins or the room not having the correct quota of towels... but it is the way in which the staff deal with these minor things and indeed the bigger things when they arise which makes a good hotel even better.... and i believe that the this hotel calls into that category..because of the staff and their attitude towards their guests
reviews.title: Hotel looks dated, air in room is stuffy as air con is not available = uncomfortable

reviews.text: the hotel was very good.It's location helped me to enjoy my staying in the city and visit all the major tourist attractions. the stuff was very kind and helpful, and the rooms were very nice. to sum up my staying was very good and i deeply recommend about this hotel
reviews.title: Older property, but great location and excellent service

reviews.text: Stayed there just before taking a plane to Italy the next day. It is conveniently located just next to the Bruxelles Nord station. The hotel is truly beautiful inside. Rooms are very comfy, with everything you need. Concierge service was great, we forgot our toothbrushes and with a simple call downstairs they were replaced within minutes. Gym is nice, with showers and sauna. There's à bar and restaurant downstairs but wé didnt try it, ate in Mam Mam which we would highly recommend too! .
reviews.title: At 60€ à night on a Friday, it's à steal!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one night last week in this fine hotel.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel in Good Location
The same as in Milano?
reviews.text: We were treated excepptionaly well at reception and received a room even though we checked in at 0600 (AM). Room was clean, pleasant even though a bit old fashioned. Bathroom is modern, apaprently recently renovated. Bed was very comforatble. Breakfast was standard with warm belgium waffles as and added nice touch. Location is great (if you are looking for shopping) as it is located right across the street from the famous main pedestrian shopping street - Rue Neuve. Situated right next to the Place Rogerier Metro station - there are easy connections to anywher you want to go within Brussels, Belgium and beyond. I highly recomend this Hotel.

We were in Crowne Plaza hotel in Milano, it was very-very good. I'am a little disappointed because in this hotel I don't see interconnected room(s) for us, for 3 persons (adults all and my daughter likes to sleep seperately). I hope...
reviews.title: Old 'grandezza' in need of modernisation

reviews.text: The hotel is around 7 minutes away from the North Station, i.e. very convenient to reach from the airport (a total of 20 min with the train). The first thing one notices is the kind of old smell you experiences as soon as you enter it - well the stunning Art Deco helps forgetting about that. The check-in is swift and competent, the staff very friendly indeed. Nevertheless, the hotel is having this kind of 'slightly chipped and worn' character. This becomes even more clear once you enter the room. It is a nice decor but it is worn out. Don't upgrade to executive status cause you will get the same room - the only difference being a bathrobe and a newspaper in the morning. And bring ear plugs since it can get quite noisy from the traffic. The bathroom is nicely spaced with the usual non-existant water pressure in Brussels. All amenities are replaced on a daily basis. If you get a bottle of water or not very much depends on your cleaning lady of the day. To sum up: good location, nice staff, but in need of renovation.
reviews.title: Good Hotel near the center of Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took advantage of the IHG newsletter for exclusive prepaid rates and for ~60 EUR (bed only) it was an unsurpassed deal in the expensive Brussels. I was not immediately recognised as a Gold member, but I finally got an upgrade to an executive room with a supresized double bed, spacious full-size bathtub and good view. Although room was prepaid, there was an amount blocked automatically from my credit card. Usually, you are asked for your credit card upon check-in and is explained that it is pre-authorisation (not charging). That was done automatically to the card on their file from the booking. I got SMS alert for the transaction and the front-desk personnel could not explain what this transaction was about. They were providing their "interpretations" for irrelevant USD to EUR conversion, inexistent room taxes etc. The smiley manager on-duty finally understood what had happened. Breakfast for promotional price 15EUR per person was very good in terms of quality, variety and frequent fill-ups. Easy 24hours parking across the intersection and 10mins walk to Grand Place via a lively commercial district. All in all, an excellent value for money and will be my first choice for my next trip.
reviews.title: Weekend rate for Priority Club members made it an unsurpassed deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights. Good location nest to Rogier metro station making it easy to reach from the Eurostar termimus at Gare du Midi. The room was a good size and clean, the bed comfortable = all you could want with the plus of free WI FI. The buffet breakfast offered a good choice and the quality was good. Also had dinner one night and the food was very good.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Was busy with various seminars etc but these did not intrude. The staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: ALL OK - FREE WIFI!!!

reviews.text: Overall a good experience and would us again.
reviews.title: 3 days of chocolate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is good, well located, clean, great breakfast; all things you expect from a 4 star hotels in the expensive city of Bruxelles.
reviews.title: Good location - especially for shopping

reviews.text: OK a slight exaggeration but the interior of this Crowne Plaza is elegant - like stepping back in time. Art Deco abounds. My room was a good size, pleasantly decorated with a descent bathroom. The outlook was disappointing as my view was another wall just a few feet away which did leave the room a little gloomy. A very comfortable bed made up for this minor irritation. A very good location for the shopping centre and the old city. Not so good for the European Commission etc but the underground system is fairly easy to use.
reviews.title: Decor to Die For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was more than adequate. The bar is cosy and the service very good. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel

reviews.text: Le Palace is a grand hotel with the character and the service to match. Stayed in late Sept. for 6 nights and was given a nice room with a very comfortable bed. Enjoyed the good breakfast which had a wide variety of food offerings. The Metro, a shopping mall, stores and all types of restaurants were nearby. The hotel's staff were always welcoming and helpful. Two individuals deserve special mention for the extraordinary service provided. Alexandre Francois, deservedly recently promoted to Guest Experience Manager, went out of his way on all occasions to resolve problems we created or encountered during our stay. His assistace was invaluable. Paulo, our Brazilian waiter, provided us numerous "must see" suggestions, many of which are generally only known by the locals. As this hotel is well located, we never had the need for a taxi. Whether arriving from, or departing to the airport or other European Cities, the North Station of the railroad is located within an 8 minute walk from the Le Palace. Would absolutely recommend this hotel to friends and stay here again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large and spacious public areas with very tasteful, stylish decor. Room fairly small but quiet and very comfortable with high quality fitments.. Excellent restaurant and very professional, yet friendly and efficient staff. Overall, a really good quality place to stay and convenient for North Station and main shopping street. This was my second stay in recent months and will return - always provided I can track down the right price deal, as it is, understandably, not the cheapest of places.
reviews.title: Do visit the park opposite too!

reviews.text: We were there for one night in early October at the end of our railway holiday with a group of 26. The hotel coped very well with our extremely late arrival and served a really nice meal. We nad a nice big room, and I am confident that the bed was comfortable, as I can't remember anything about it at all except my phone alarm waking me up!
reviews.title: Be careful on extra charges

reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience while staying at the Crowne Plaza Hotel Brussels on a business trip. The staff was courteous and nice. The guestroom was spacious, comfortable and perfectly designed for a business traveler (with a large desk). The food in the restaurant was great and the waiter went the extra mile and did everything he could to accommodate my special requests. The breakfast buffet is healthy and succulent! Overall, the experience was wonderful!
reviews.title: Excellent service, spacious guestrooms and good food!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in October 2011, it is situated in a strategic location, you can easily reach the various parts of the city of Brussels and the airport. The service is excellent, I found greatest kindness and courtesy.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night last August. I found it particularly convenient for visiting the town center without the fuss of the center itself. It sits right across the street of the point where the shopping area starts, and it took us only15 minutes to walk to the Grande Place.
reviews.title: Conveniently located, cosy but nothing special

reviews.text: Personnel was very friendly and helpful, while I also found convenient that tickets were sold at the reception desk for several tours around the city. The room was clean and very quiet, though the furniture reminded me of past decades. I didn't particularly like that our room window faced the window of room at the opposite ward, which meant that we had to keep the curtains drawn for the duration of our stay.
reviews.title: Great location for city break

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine, but nothing I didn't expect at a four-star hotel. All in all, I think this is an ideal hotel for someone who's visiting Brussels for business or sight-seeing and not really interested in staying in and enjoying the pleasures of the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent service, bad internet

description: Discover a Palace of today! Dating back to 1908, Crowne Plaza Brussels - Le Palace has a long distinguished history and has been at the heart of Brussels’ daily life since the day it opened. Today the hotel is committed to preserving its unique traditions while providing new and modern comforts for its guests. 354 splendidly decorated guestrooms have a unique style, Art Nouveau and Deco inspired. Quality beds, soft big sweet dream pillows, etc.
